sources.title: Alibi (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Banned in Chicago the year it was released for "immorality", Alibi was nominated for three Academy Awards, and was thought of as the greatest gangster film yet made. Modern reviews are less glowing, but the picture still serves as an interesting Pre-code crime drama.Â

sources.title: Alibi (1929) CHESTER MORRIS
sources.description:
PRE-CODE HOLLYWOOD
Writer/Director: Roland West
Stars: Chester Morris, Regis Toomey, Mae Busch

A gangster is the prime suspect of a murdered policeman, but his Alibi is rock solid... or is it? This early talkie was nominated for three Academy Awards: Best Picture, Best Actor, and Best Art Direction.

metadata.Plot: Chick Williams, a prohibition gangster, rejoins his mob soon after being released from prison. When a policeman is murdered during a robbery, he falls under suspicion. The gangster took Joan, a policeman's daughter, to the theater, sneaked out during the intermission to commit the crime, then used her to support his alibi. The detective squad employs its most sophisticated and barbaric techniques, including planting an undercover agent in the gang, to bring him to justice.
metadata.Writer: Roland West, C. Gardner Sullivan, John Griffith Wray
metadata.Actors: Chester Morris, Harry Stubbs, Mae Busch
